source.405768d8:
from sklearn.cluster import KMeans
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
source.2da1831f:
X = df.loc[:, ['Annual Income (k$)', 'Spending Score (1-100)']].values
count= []
for i in range(1, 11):
    kmeans = KMeans(n_clusters = i, init = 'k-means++')
    kmeans.fit(X)
    count.append(kmeans.inertia_)

plt.figure(figsize = (12, 7))

plt.plot(range(1, 11), count, linewidth = 2, marker = '8')
plt.title('Elbow Plot', fontsize =12)
plt.xlabel('K')
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.show()
source.f7308094:
plt.figure(figsize = (14, 8))
plt.scatter(X[:, 0], X[:, 1], c = kmeans.labels_, s = 105)
plt.title('Clusters of Customers\n', fontsize = 20)
plt.xlabel('Annual Income (k$)')
plt.ylabel('Spending Score (1-100)')
plt.show()
source.1a0f5263: EDA Conclusion : Age group between 28-36 spend more compare to other age group similarly female are found to spend more comapre to men exclude age group 36-49 whereas female have low annual income til age of 36 hence  we can say that person with higher are not spending more compare to low annual income overall its lies between 40-50 spending score.
